Gets the point(s) at a certain percentage along the piecewise bezier curve

Parameters:

  • t (Union[List[float],float,np.ndarray]) ‚Äì percentage(s) along a bezier curve. You can specify a float, List[float], or a numpy array

  • equal_space (bool, optional) ‚Äì Equally space points using arc length. Defaults to False.

Returns:

containing

  • x (np.ndarray): x-coordinates

  • y (np.ndarray): y-coordinates

(Tuple)

pyturbo.helper.bisect.bisect(func, lb: float, ub: float, tol: float = 1e-05, verbose: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bisection method, solves for 0 given a function, lower bound, upper bound inputs:

func - function handle lb - lower bound ub - upper bound tol - tolerance, when to stop the minimization *args - arguments that will be passed in addition to the function

returns

x - value that minimizes the function flag = 1 (good,passed) -1 (max iterations reached)

similar to matlab‚Äôs cubic spline interpolator

Parameters:

  • y (numpy.ndarray) ‚Äì n x 1 array

  • xx (numpy.ndarray) ‚Äì n x 1 array of where you want to estimate y

Returns:

spline estimated values where xx is specified

(numpy.ndarray)

class pyturbo.helper.wave.wave_control(wave_array: List[float])[source]ÔÉÅ

This is used to control a wave‚Äôs starting ending location as well as invert the wave

get_wave(percent_start=0, percent_end=1, bInverse=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Get the normalized value of the waves

Parameters:

  • percent_start (int, optional) ‚Äì _description_. Defaults to 0.

  • percent_end (int, optional) ‚Äì _description_. Defaults to 1.

  • bInverse (bool, optional) ‚Äì True - wave starts on the outside of the end points. False - wave starts between the bounds. Defaults to False.

Returns:

array containing the wave

Return type:

npt.NDArray
